title: Ruth Davidson abandons plan to take second job with lobbying firm
text:
Ruth Davidson has abandoned her plan to take a second job as a senior adviser with a City and PR and lobbying firm following a storm of criticism.

The former Scottish Tory leader said she and Tulchan Communications "agreed not to proceed with the appointment" for which she would have been paid £50,000 for 25 days' work a year on top of her MSP salary of £63,579.

She said the furore over the job had become "increasingly contentious" and pledged to focus on being the Edinburgh Central MSP "if I am asked to choose."

Ms Davidson continued to insist there was no conflict of interest between the two posts, reiterating that she had checked with Scottish Parliament officials in advance.

description: Ruth Davidson has abandoned her plan to take a second job as a senior adviser with a City and PR and lobbying firm following a storm of criticism.
